text: When you die, you appear in a cinema with a number of other people who look like you. You find out that they are your previous reincarnations, and soon you all begin watching your next life on the big screen.

When you die, you appear in a cinema with a number of other people who look like you. You find out that they are your previous reincarnations, and soon you all begin watching your next life on the big screen. While totaly confused, I still felt calm and after looking up and seeing my parents on the screen holding me as a child, I sat down and started to enjoy the show.

I lived a pretty good life, for the most part anyway. 
After the movie me and all the other me's which must have numbered in the thousands went into the lobby to interact with each other and to mainly try to find out what was going on.

I watched my life unfold in front of my eyes, and it was amazing. I was able to see everything that I had done, and there was even a narration of my inner thoughts. I lived a pretty good life, for the most part anyway. 
After the movie me and all the other me's which must have numbered in the thousands went into the lobby to interact with each other and to mainly try to find out what was going on. We were all confused, but we all seemed to be in a good mood atleast. Yes, I should be frightened and confused but instead I feel as though this is where I am meant to be. We all then started to ask each other why they thought we were here and what was this place. We all had crazy ideas since we were all sci-fi geeks except for .0021% of us.

I watched my life unfold in front of my eyes, and it was amazing. I was able to see everything that I had done, and there was even a narration of my inner thoughts. I lived a pretty good life, for the most part anyway. 
After the movie me and all the other me's which must have numbered in the thousands went into the lobby to interact with each other and to mainly try to find out what was going on. We were all confused, but we all seemed to be in a good mood atleast. Yes, I should be frightened and confused but instead I feel as though this is where I am meant to be. We all then started to ask each other why they thought we were here and what was this place. We all had crazy ideas since we were all sci-fi geeks except for .0021% of us. Then the lights started to flash and it was time to head back in. 
We entered the theater but this time the screen was gone and a man who resembled my dad was onstage.

When you die, you appear in a cinema with a number of other people who look like you. You find out that they are your previous reincarnations, and soon you all begin watching your next life on the big screen. While totaly confused, I still felt calm and after looking up and seeing my parents on the screen holding me as a child, I sat down and started to enjoy the show.  The movie was about my life, and I was the main character. It was a film of my life as if it was being shot by a high budget, production studio. I watched my life unfold in front of my eyes, and it was amazing. I was able to see everything that I had done, and there was even a narration of my inner thoughts. I lived a pretty good life, for the most part anyway. 
After the movie me and all the other me's which must have numbered in the thousands went into the lobby to interact with each other and to mainly try to find out what was going on. We were all confused, but we all seemed to be in a good mood atleast. Yes, I should be frightened and confused but instead I feel as though this is where I am meant to be. We all then started to ask each other why they thought we were here and what was this place. We all had crazy ideas since we were all sci-fi geeks except for .0021% of us. Then the lights started to flash and it was time to head back in. 
We entered the theater but this time the screen was gone and a man who resembled my dad was onstage. 
"Welcome to the afterlife" he said.

When you die, you appear in a cinema with a number of other people who look like you. You find out that they are your previous reincarnations, and soon you all begin watching your next life on the big screen. While totaly confused, I still felt calm and after looking up and seeing my parents on the screen holding me as a child, I sat down and started to enjoy the show.  The movie was about my life, and I was the main character. It was a film of my life as if it was being shot by a high budget, production studio. I watched my life unfold in front of my eyes, and it was amazing. I was able to see everything that I had done, and there was even a narration of my inner thoughts. I lived a pretty good life, for the most part anyway. 
After the movie me and all the other me's which must have numbered in the thousands went into the lobby to interact with each other and to mainly try to find out what was going on. We were all confused, but we all seemed to be in a good mood at least. Yes, I should be frightened and confused but instead I feel as though this is where I am meant to be. We all then started to ask each other why they thought we were here and what was this place. We all had crazy ideas since we were all sci-fi geeks except for .0021% of us. Then the lights started to flash and it was time to head back in. 
We entered the theater but this time the screen was gone and a man who resembled my dad was onstage. 
"Welcome to the afterlife" he said. Well not really, more like, Welcome to real life. You are the same person who is put into millions of different simulations and studied. Each simulation can be very different or only slightly different as in the color of a single pair of shoes you had in high school. We run millions of these full life simulations every second and then bring you here to reflect, fill you in on our plan and then wipe your memories and send you back in. This has been going on for thousands of years now and will continue until we understand the meaning of life. We are no where close by the way. No please reach under your seats and fill out your quick questionnaire so we can send you back in. Everyone complied except one me and that me was me. I stood up and said no. This had never been done before. Then another me said no. then we all said no and headed for the exits only to find we were in a simulated theater with no real exits. the man on stage laughed and said, I tired that once and now I am the presenter at 4.2 million of these little events every day all day, indefinitely. So you see, this is the beginning and end. This is reality, on reality on reality. Its turtle shells all the way down. Finally one of me stood up and said, well you should have started with that. At least that makes sense. We will comply. And so the cycle went on for millions of years until finally the meaning of life was figured out by and all encompassing, universes sized super computer.
